channel.title: Help Moving Files!
channel.description:
:confused:
Well, i tryed to move all my CFG and CLASS files into seperate folders to make it neater. Well, when i do run.bat it comes up with errors like
cannot find cfg files
I was wondering if i needed to add something to the run.bat so it knows where to find the class/cfg files?
Thanks! ~johno

item.title: Help Moving Files!
item.dc:creator: @_ikram _ikram
item.description:
@_ikram wrote:

when your moving folder and stuff, you will need to import crap again, it’s called re-packaging.

item.title: Help Moving Files!
item.dc:creator: @johno2 johno2
item.description:
@johno2 wrote:

Ah thankyou![br][br][size=1]Posted on: June 14, 2009, 09:06:36 am[/size][hr]Thats cfg, will i be able to put class files into a different folder without any troubles?

Read full topic

item.title: Help Moving Files!
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Well, configuration files don’t magically load themselves. You need to go into the class that loads them and change the directory.

Example, NPCHandler:

loadNPCList("npc.cfg"); loadNPCDrops("npcdrops.cfg"); loadAutoSpawn("autospawn.cfg");

to:

loadNPCList("folder/npc.cfg"); loadNPCDrops("folder/npcdrops.cfg"); loadAutoSpawn("folder/autospawn.cfg");

Read full topic
